title: Ticket #4816: Prevent changes to job id of queued jobs
description:
The schedd does some simple checking to prevent a job's ClusterId and ProcId attributes from being modified. However, the check code in SetAttribute() assumes the value to be verified will be an integer literal. A client can bypass this by setting a value that's a ClassAd expression that begins with the job's valid ClusterId or ProcId.

For example, to change a job's job id from 16.0 to 15.0, a user can do this: 

condor_qedit 16.0 clusterid '16 - 1'

This example also bypasses a check in condor_qedit that does a case-senstive comparison on the attribute name when it should do a case-insensitive comparison.

Doing this doesn't change the job's key in the job_queue.log maintained by the schedd.
